solution_line_template: 1 minute is {seconds_per_minute} seconds, so {duration_minutes} minutes is {duration_minutes} * {seconds_per_minute} = <<{duration_minutes}*{seconds_per_minute}={total_seconds}>>{total_seconds} seconds.
During this time there would be {total_seconds} / {big_crash_interval} = <<{total_seconds}/{big_crash_interval}={num_big_crashes}>>{num_big_crashes} big crashes.
So in total during {duration_minutes} minutes there would be {num_big_crashes} + {num_car_collisions} = <<{num_big_crashes}+{num_car_collisions}={total_accidents}>>{total_accidents} accidents.
